sampleApplications.applicationTextDescription: This application is designed to enables you to identify the subject in an image. The use cases use the Qualcomm Neural Processing SDK, LiteRT, or Qualcomm AI Engine direct models.
This application is designed to enables you to detect objects within images and videos. The use cases show the execution of YOLOv5, YOLOv8, and YOLO-NAS on Qualcomm AI HW accelerator
This application allows Pose Detection of human target using Camera, File and RTSP. The use cases supports Qualcomm Neural Processing SDK, LiteRT, or Qualcomm AI Engine direct models.
This application capture video snapshot when human is encountered on Camera, File and RTSP Input.
This application enables you to divide an image into different and meaningful parts or segments and assign a label to each homogenous segment based on the similarity of the attributes.
This application is designed to enables you to infer depth of a source feed from a live camera stream, file, or an RTSP stream.
This application demonstrates video super resolution on input file stream, and outputs the result as file or as display preview
This application enables you to perform object detection, object classification, pose detection, and image segmentation on an input stream
This application demonstrates object detection/classification on upto 16 input streams coming from camera and/or files and/or rtsp streams
This application demonstrates batched object detection/image segmentation on upto 24 input files streams
This application demonstrates object detection over multiple input/output stream combinations. Input streams can come from camera/file/rtsp and output can be display or file or rtsp
This application demonstrates Daisychain of object detection and pose detection for input coming from camera/file/rtsp
This application demonstrates parsing of metadata obtained from result of Object Detection to obtain people count in input coming from camera, file or rtsp stream
This application demonstrates face detection on live video input from a camera, file, or an RTSP stream.
This application demonstrates face recognition on the live video input from a camera or an RTSP stream.
The gst-ai-audio-classification application shows the audio classification using the input from a file source and microphone. The classification results and video preview are displayed.
The gst-ai-audio-classification application shows the audio classification using the input from a file source and microphone. The classification results and video preview are displayed.
This application is designed to enables you to detect objects with USB camera input.
This application demonstrates Daisychain of object detection and object classification for input coming from camera/file/rtsp
This application demonstrate the ability of the qmmfsrc to activate and deactivate the streams runtime, without a reconfiguration and gap on already activated streams
This application demonstrate the ability of the qmmfsrc to add or remove the streams runtime with camera reconfiguration
This application Demonstrates executing of appsink when new sample is available in the pipeline then application extracts the buffer from the sample for further processing
This application Demonstrates single camera usecases with possible outputs, Live Camera Preview on Display, Store the Video encoder output, Dump the Camera YUV, Live RTSP streaming
This application uses the two cameras of the device and switch them without changing the state of the pipeline. The switching is done in playing state every 5 seconds
This application Demonstrates multicamera live preview on display or dumping video encoder output
This is an application to demonstrate transform video stream such as rotate, flip and scale on input live camera stream or file source of H264 codec. Output goes to display and also dumps to mp4 file
This application Demonstrates compostion using qtivcomposer for both picture in picture and side by side usecases. One input is from camera source and other is from AVC mp4 file source
This is an application to demonstrate the Concurrent video playback of any supported resolution and composition on display (Video wall)
